info.description:
Wavefront public APIs enable you to interact with Wavefront servers using standard web service API tools. You can use the APIs to automate commonly executed operations such as automatically tagging sources.

When you make API calls outside the Wavefront UI you must add the header "Authorization: Bearer <<API-TOKEN>>" to your HTTP requests.

For legacy versions of the Wavefront API, see the legacy API documentation.
info.title: Wavefront Public API

get.summary: Get all agents for a customer
Get a specific agent

put.summary: Update the name of a specific agent

parameters.name: body

post.summary: Undelete a specific agent

get.summary: Get all alerts for a customer

post.summary: Create a specific alert

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
Example Body: 
{
  "name": "Alert Name",
  "target": "user@example.com",
  "condition": "ts() > 1",
  "displayExpression": "ts()",
  "minutes": 5,
  "resolveAfterMinutes": 2,
  "severity": "INFO",
  "additionalInformation": "Additional Info"
}

get.summary: Count alerts of various statuses for a customer
Get a specific alert

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
Example Body: 
{
  "id": "1459375928549",
  "name": "Alert Name",
  "target": "user@example.com",
  "condition": "ts() > 1",
  "displayExpression": "ts()",
  "minutes": 5,
  "resolveAfterMinutes": 2,
  "severity": "INFO",
  "additionalInformation": "Additional Info"
}

get.summary: Perform a charting query against Wavefront servers that returns the appropriate points in the specified time window and granularity
get.description: Long time spans and small granularities can take a long time to calculate

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: name used to identify the query

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: the query expression to execute

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: the start time of the query window in epoch milliseconds

parameters.name: e
parameters.description: the end time of the query window in epoch milliseconds (null to use now)

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: the granularity of the points returned

parameters.name: p
parameters.description: the maximum number of points to return

parameters.name: i
parameters.description: whether series with only points that are outside of the query window will be returned (defaults to true)

parameters.name: autoEvents
parameters.description: whether events for sources included in the query will be automatically returned by the query

parameters.name: summarization
parameters.description: summarization strategy to use when bucketing points together

parameters.name: listMode
parameters.description: retrieve events more optimally displayed for a list

parameters.name: strict
parameters.description: do not return points outside the query window [s;e), defaults to false

parameters.name: includeObsoleteMetrics
parameters.description: include metrics that have not been reporting recently, defaults to false

parameters.name: sorted
parameters.description: sorts the output so that returned series are in order, defaults to false

get.summary: Get more details on a metric, including reporting sources and approximate last time reported

parameters.name: m
parameters.description: Metric name

parameters.name: c
parameters.description: cursor value to continue if the number of results exceeds 1000

parameters.name: h
parameters.description: glob pattern for sources to include in the query result

get.summary: Perform a raw data query against Wavefront servers that returns second granularity points grouped by tags
get.description: An API to check if ingested points are as expected.  Points ingested within a single second are averaged when returned.

parameters.name: host
parameters.description: host to query ingested points for (cannot contain wildcards). host or source is equivalent, only one should be used.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: source to query ingested points for (cannot contain wildcards). host or source is equivalent, only one should be used.

parameters.name: metric
parameters.description: metric to query ingested points for (cannot contain wildcards)

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: start time in epoch milliseconds (cannot be more than a day in the past) null to use an hour before endTime

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: end time in epoch milliseconds (cannot be more than a day in the past) null to use now

404.description: Metric not found for specified source/host

get.summary: Get all webhooks for a customer

post.summary: Create a specific webhook

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
Example Body: 
{
  "description": "WebHook Description",
  "template": "POST Body -- Mustache syntax",
  "title": "WebHook Title",
  "triggers": [
    "ALERT_OPENED"
  ],
  "recipient": "http://example.com",
  "customHttpHeaders": {},
  "contentType": "text/plain"
}

  ],

cursor.description: The id at which the current (limited) search can be continued to obtain more matching items

totalItems.description: An estimate (lower-bound) of the total number of items available for return.  May not be a tight estimate for facet queries

moreItems.description: Whether more items are available for return by increment offset or cursor

sort.description: How returned items have been sorted

alertCounts.description: A map from alert state to the number of alerts in that state within the search results

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerPagedExternalLink.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

cursor.description: The id at which the current (limited) search can be continued to obtain more matching items

totalItems.description: An estimate (lower-bound) of the total number of items available for return.  May not be a tight estimate for facet queries

moreItems.description: Whether more items are available for return by increment offset or cursor

sort.description: How returned items have been sorted

scatterPlotSource.description: For scatter plots, does this query source the X-axis or the Y-axis

secondaryAxis.description: Determines if this source relates to the right hand Y-axis or not

sourceDescription.description: A description for the purpose of this source

querybuilderEnabled.description: Whether or not this source line should have the query builder enabled

query.description: Query expression to plot on the chart

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerPagedAgent.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

cursor.description: The id at which the current (limited) search can be continued to obtain more matching items

totalItems.description: An estimate (lower-bound) of the total number of items available for return.  May not be a tight estimate for facet queries

sort.description: How returned items have been sorted

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerPagedMessage.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

hosts.description: List of sources/hosts reporting this metric

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerPagedSource.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

host.description: Source (or host).  "Source" and "host" are synonyms in current versions of wavefront, but the host terminology is deprecated

SourceLabelPair.description: Convenience wrapper for the identifier of a unique series, which consists of a source (host) and a metric or aggregation (label)

lastCheckInTime.description: Last time when this agent checked in (in milliseconds since the unix epoch)

hostname.description: Host name of the machine running the agent

timeDrift.description: Time drift of the agent's clock compared to Wavefront servers

bytesLeftForBuffer.description: Number of bytes of space remaining in the persistent disk queue of this agent

bytesPerMinuteForBuffer.description: Bytes used per minute by the persistent disk queue of this agent

localQueueSize.description: Number of items in the persistent disk queue of this agent

ephemeral.description: When true, this agent is expected to be ephemeral (possibly hosted on a short-lived container) and will be deleted after a period of inactivity (not checking in)

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerSource.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

cursor.description: The id at which the current (limited) search can be continued to obtain more matching items

totalItems.description: An estimate (lower-bound) of the total number of items available for return.  May not be a tight estimate for facet queries

moreItems.description: Whether more items are available for return by increment offset or cursor

sort.description: How returned items have been sorted

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerWebhook.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

type.description: Chart Type.  'line' refers to the Line Plot, 'scatter' to the Point Plot, 'stacked-area' to the Stacked Area plot, 'table' to the Tabular View, 'scatterploy-xy' to Scatter Plot, 'markdown-widget' to the Markdown display, and 'sparkline' to the Single Stat view

max.description: Max value of Y-axis.  Set to null or leave blank for auto

y1Units.description: For plots with multiple Y-axes, units for right-side Y-axis

min.description: Min value of Y-axis.  Set to null or leave blank for auto

y1Min.description: For plots with multiple Y-axes, min value for right-side Y-axis.  Set null for auto

y1Max.description: For plots with multiple Y-axes, max value for right-side Y-axis.  Set null for auto

windowSize.description: Width, in minutes, of the time window to use for "last" windowing

y0ScaleSIBy1024.description: Default: false. Whether to scale numerical magnitude labels for left Y-axis by 1024 in the IEC/Binary manner (instead of by 1000 like SI)

y0UnitAutoscaling.description: Default: false. Whether to automatically adjust magnitude labels and units for the left Y-axis to favor smaller magnitudes and larger units

y1ScaleSIBy1024.description: Default: false. Whether to scale numerical magnitude labels for right Y-axis by 1024 in the IEC/Binary manner (instead of by 1000 like SI)

y1UnitAutoscaling.description: Default: false. Whether to automatically adjust magnitude labels and units for the right Y-axis to favor smaller magnitudes and larger units

expectedDataSpacing.description: Threshold (in seconds) for time delta between consecutive points in a series above which a dotted line will replace a solid line in line plots.  Default: 60s

lineType.description: Plot interpolation type.  linear is default

groupBySource.description: For the tabular view, whether to group multi metrics into a single row by a common source.  If false, each metric for each source is displayed in its own row.  If true, multiple metrics for the same host will be displayed as different columns in the same row

stackType.description: Type of stacked chart (applicable only if chart type is stacked).  zero (default) means stacked from y=0.  expand means Normalized from 0 to 1.  wiggle means Minimize weighted changes. silhouette means to Center the Stream

ymin.description: For x-y scatterplots, min value for Y-axis.  Set null for auto

ymax.description: For x-y scatterplots, max value for Y-axis.  Set null for auto

xmin.description: For x-y scatterplots, min value for X-axis.  Set null for auto

xmax.description: For x-y scatterplots, max value for X-axis.  Set null for auto

timeBasedColoring.description: Fox x-y scatterplots, whether to color more recent points as darker than older points. Default: false

customTags.description: For the tabular view, a list of point tags to display when using the "custom" tag display mode

numTags.description: For the tabular view, how many point tags to display

showHosts.description: For the tabular view, whether to display sources.  Default: true

showLabels.description: For the tabular view, whether to display labels.  Default: true

showRawValues.description: For the tabular view, whether to display raw values.  Default: false

sortValuesDescending.description: For the tabular view, whether to display display values in descending order.  Default: false

windowing.description: For the tabular view, whether to use the full time window for the query or the last X minutes

tagMode.description: For the tabular view, which mode to use to determine which point tags to display

fixedLegendEnabled.description: Whether to enable a fixed tabular legend adjacent to the chart

fixedLegendPosition.description: Where the fixed legend should be displayed with respect to the chart

fixedLegendDisplayStats.description: For a chart with a fixed legend, a list of statistics to display in the legend

fixedLegendFilterField.description: Statistic to use for determining whether a series is displayed on the fixed legend

fixedLegendFilterLimit.description: Number of series to include in the fixed legend

fixedLegendFilterSort.description: Whether to display "Top"- or "Bottom"-ranked series in the fixed legend

fixedLegendUseRawStats.description: If true, the legend uses non-summarized stats instead of summarized

invertDynamicLegendHoverControl.description: Whether to disable the display of the floating legend (but reenable it when the ctrl-key is pressed)

sparklineDecimalPrecision.description: For the single stat view, the decimal precision of the displayed number

sparklineDisplayColor.description: For the single stat view, the color of the displayed text (when not dynamically determined). Values should be in"rgba(<rval>, <gval>, <bval>, <aval>" format

sparklineDisplayFontSize.description: For the single stat view, the font size of the displayed text, in percent

sparklineDisplayHorizontalPosition.description: For the single stat view, the horizontal position of the displayed text

sparklineDisplayPostfix.description: For the single stat view, a string to append to the displayed text

sparklineDisplayPrefix.description: For the single stat view, a string to add before the displayed text

sparklineDisplayValueType.description: For the single stat view, whether to display the name of the query or the value of query

sparklineFillColor.description: For the single stat view, the color of the background fill. Values should be in"rgba(<rval>, <gval>, <bval>, <aval>" format

sparklineLineColor.description: For the single stat view, the color of the line. Values should be in"rgba(<rval>, <gval>, <bval>, <aval>" format

sparklineSize.description: For the single stat view, a misleadingly named property.  This determines whether the sparkline of the statistic is displayed in the chart BACKGROUND, BOTTOM, or NONE

sparklineValueColorMapApplyTo.description: For the single stat view, whether to apply dynamic color settings to the displayed TEXT or BACKGROUND

sparklineValueColorMapColors.description: For the single stat view, a list of colors that differing query values map to.  Must contain one more element than sparklineValueColorMapValuesV2. Values should be in"rgba(<rval>, <gval>, <bval>, <aval>" format

sparklineValueColorMapValuesV2.description: For the single stat view, a list of boundaries for mapping different query values to colors.  Must contain one less element than sparklineValueColorMapColors

sparklineValueTextMapText.description: For the single stat view, a list of display text values that different query values map to.  Must contain one more element than sparklineValueTextMapThresholds

sparklineValueTextMapThresholds.description: For the single stat view, a list of threshold boundaries for mapping different query values to display text. Must contain one less element than sparklineValueTextMapText

markdownContent.description: The Markdown content for a Markdown display

ChartSettings.description: Representation of the settings of a Wavefront chart

facets.description: A list of facets (property keys) to return values from found in entities matching 'query'.  Examples are 'tags', 'creatorId', etc

facetQuery.description: A string against which facet results are compared.  If the facet result either CONTAINs, STARTSWITH, or is an EXACT match for this value, as specified by facetQueryMatchingMethod, then it is returned

facetQueryMatchingMethod.description: The matching method used to filter when 'facetQuery' is used. Defaults to CONTAINS.

query.description: A list of queries by which to limit the search results.  Entities that match ALL queries in this list constitute a set of 'entity search results'.  All facets listed in the 'facets' search parameter of all entities within 'entity search results' are scanned to produce the search results (of facet values).

limit.description: The number of results to return.  Default 100

HistoryEntry.description: An entry in the edit-history of an entity such as alert or dashboard

cursor.description: The id (exclusive) from which search results resume returning.  Users should supply an entity 'id' to this property.  Its main purpose is to resume where a previous search left off because of the 'limit' parameter.  If a user supplies the last id in a set of results to cursor, while keeping the query the same, the system will return the next page of results

query.description: A list of queries by which to limit the search results

timeRange.description: Time range for refining the event search.  Operates on the *starting time* of each event

reason.description: The purpose of this maintenance window

startTimeInSeconds.description: The time in epoch seconds when this maintenance window will start

endTimeInSeconds.description: The time in epoch seconds when this maintenance window will end

relevantCustomerTags.description: List of alert tags whose matching alerts will be put into maintenance because of this maintenance window

relevantHostNames.description: List of source/host names that will be put into maintenance because of this maintenance window

relevantHostTags.description: List of source/host tags whose matching sources/hosts will be put into maintenance because of this maintenance window

relevantHostTagsAnded.description: Whether to AND source/host tags listed in relevantHostTags. If true, a source/host must contain all tags in order for the maintenance window to apply.  If false, the tags are OR'ed, and a source/host must contain one of the tags. Default: false

hostTagGroupHostNamesGroupAnded.description: If true, a source/host must be in 'relevantHostNames' and have tags matching the specification formed by 'relevantHostTags' and 'relevantHostTagsAnded' in order for this maintenance window to apply. If false, a source/host must either be in 'relevantHostNames' or match 'relevantHostTags' and 'relevantHostTagsAnded'. Default: false

eventName.description: The name of an event associated with the creation/update of this maintenance window

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerFacetResponse.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerPagedDashboard.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerAlert.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

heightFactor.description: Scalar for the height of this row. 100 is normal and default. 50 is half height

query.description: The map corresponding to the search query.  The key is the name of the query, and the value is a JSON representation of the query

userId.description: The user for whom this search is saved

entityType.description: The Wavefront entity type over which to search

SavedSearch.description: Saved queries for searches over Wavefront entities

tags.description: Associated tags of the time series

limit.description: The number of results to return.  Default: 100

offset.description: The number of results to skip before returning values.  Default: 0

query.description: A list of queries by which to limit the search results.  Entities that match ALL queries in the list are returned

facetQuery.description: A string against which facet results are compared.  If the facet result CONTAINs, STARTSWITH, or is an EXACT match for this value, as specified by facetQueryMatchingMethod, then it is returned.

facetQueryMatchingMethod.description: The matching method used to filter when 'facetQuery' is used. Defaults to CONTAINS.

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerMaintenanceWindow.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

identifier.description: The unique identifier of this user, which must be their valid email address

customer.description: The id of the customer to which this user belongs

groups.description: The permissions granted to this user

metricFilterRegex.description: A regular expression that a CloudWatch metric name must match (case-insensitively) in order to be ingested

instanceSelectionTags.description: A comma-separated white list of AWS instance tag-value pairs (in AWS).  If the instance's AWS tags match this whitelist, CloudWatch data about this instance is ingested.  Multiple entries are OR'ed

volumeSelectionTags.description: A comma-separated white list of AWS volume tag-value pairs (in AWS).  If the volume's AWS tags match this whitelist, CloudWatch data about this volume is ingested.  Multiple entries are OR'ed

CloudWatchConfiguration.description: Configuration specific to the CloudWatch AWS integration

query.description: The query string used to obtain this result

warnings.description: The warnings incurred by this query

timeseries.description: The time series data for this query

events.description: The events occurring during this time span

cursor.description: The id at which the current (limited) search can be continued to obtain more matching items

totalItems.description: An estimate (lower-bound) of the total number of items available for return.  May not be a tight estimate for facet queries

moreItems.description: Whether more items are available for return by increment offset or cursor

sort.description: How returned items have been sorted

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerPaged.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerPagedMaintenanceWindow.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

last_update.description: Approximate time of last reporting, in milliseconds since the Unix epoch

tags.description: A key-value map of the point tags associated with this source

units.description: String to label the units of the chart on the Y-axis

base.description: If the chart has a log-scale Y-axis, the base for the logarithms

includeObsoleteMetrics.description: Whether to show obsolete metrics.  Default: false

sources.description: Query expression to plot on the chart

noDefaultEvents.description: Whether to hide events related to the sources in the charts produced. Default false (i.e. shows events)

interpolatePoints.description: Whether to interpolate points in the charts produced. Default: true

summarization.description: Summarization strategy for the chart.  MEAN is default

key.description: The entity facet (key) by which to search.  Valid keys are any property keys returned by the JSON representation of the entity.  Examples are 'creatorId', 'name', etc.  The following special key keywords are also valid:  'tags' performs a search on entity tags, 'tagpath' performs a hierarchical search on tags, with  periods (.) as path level separators.  'freetext' performs a free text search across many fields of the entity

value.description: The entity facet value for which to search

matchingMethod.description: The method by which search matching is performed.  Default: CONTAINS

cursor.description: The id at which the current (limited) search can be continued to obtain more matching items

totalItems.description: An estimate (lower-bound) of the total number of items available for return.  May not be a tight estimate for facet queries

moreItems.description: Whether more items are available for return by increment offset or cursor

sort.description: How returned items have been sorted

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerTagsResponse.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

name.description: The name of the event.  If 'annotations.prettyName' is present, 'name' will be equivalent to that value

annotations.description: A string->string map of additional annotations on the event

table.description: The customer to which the event belongs

hosts.description: A list of sources/hosts affected by the event

endTime.description: End time of the event, in epoch millis.  Set to startTime + 1 for an instantaneous event

summarizedEvents.description: In some event queries, multiple events that occur nearly simultaneously are summarized under a single event.  This value specifies the number of events summarized under this one

isUserEvent.description: Whether this event was created by a user, versus the system.  Default: system

isEphemeral.description: Whether the event ends immediately after it begins

startTime.description: Start time of the event, in epoch millis.  If the JSON value is missing or set to 0, startTime will be set to the current time

template.description: A mustache template that will form the body of the POST request sent as the web hook.

triggers.description: A list of occurrences on which this webhook will be fired.  Valid values are ALERT_OPENED, ALERT_UPDATED, ALERT_RESOLVED, ALERT_MAINTENANCE, ALERT_SNOOZED

recipient.description: The URL to which this webhook will be delivered

customHttpHeaders.description: A string->string map specifying the custom HTTP header key / value pairs that will be sent in the requests of this web hook

contentType.description: The value of the Content-Type header of the webhook POST request.

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerPagedAlert.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainer.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

cursor.description: The id at which the current (limited) search can be continued to obtain more matching items

totalItems.description: An estimate (lower-bound) of the total number of items available for return.  May not be a tight estimate for facet queries

moreItems.description: Whether more items are available for return by increment offset or cursor

sort.description: How returned items have been sorted

id.description: Unique identifier, also URL slug, of the dashboard

parameters.description: Deprecated.  An obsolete representation of dashboard parameters

customer.description: id of the customer to which this dashboard belongs

url.description: Unique identifier, also URL slug, of the dashboard

eventFilterType.description: How charts belonging to this dashboard should display events.  BYCHART is default if unspecified

parameterDetails.description: The current (as of Wavefront 4.0) JSON representation of dashboard parameters.  This is a map from a parameter name to its representation

displayDescription.description: Whether the dashboard description section is opened by default when the dashboard is shown

displaySectionTableOfContents.description: Whether the "pills" quick-linked the sections of the dashboard are displayed by default when the dashboard is shown

displayQueryParameters.description: Whether the dashboard parameters section is opened by default when the dashboard is shown

chartTitleScalar.description: Scale (normally 100) of chart title text size

eventQuery.description: Event query to run on dashboard charts

chartTitleColor.description: Text color of the chart title text are, in rgba(rvalue,gvalue,bvalue,avalue)

chartTitleBgColor.description: Background color of the chart title text area, in rgba(rvalue,gvalue,bvalue,avalue)

systemOwned.description: Whether this dashboard is system-owned and not writeable

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerFacetsResponseContainer.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

cursor.description: The id at which the current (limited) search can be continued to obtain more matching items

totalItems.description: An estimate (lower-bound) of the total number of items available for return.  May not be a tight estimate for facet queries

moreItems.description: Whether more items are available for return by increment offset or cursor

sort.description: How returned items have been sorted

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

totalItems.description: An estimate (lower-bound) of the total number of items available for return.  May not be a tight estimate for facet queries

ResponseContainerPagedWebhook.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerPagedCloudIntegration.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

earliestStartTimeEpochMillis.description: Start of search time window, in milliseconds since the Unix Epoch.  Events whose start time occurs after this value will be returned.  If no value is supplied, defaults to 2 hours prior the present time.

latestStartTimeEpochMillis.description: End of the search time window, in milliseconds since the Unix Epoch.  Events whose start time occurs before this value will be returned.   If no value is supplied, defaults to now.

EventTimeRange.description: Refinement of time range over which to search (for events)

name.description: Name of the external link.  Will be displayed in context (right-click) menus on charts

template.description: The mustache template for this link.  This template must expand to a full URL, including scheme, origin, etc

metricFilterRegex.description: Controls whether a link displayed in the context menu of a highlighted series.  If present, the metric name of the highlighted series must match this regular expression in order for the link to be displayed

sourceFilterRegex.description: Controls whether a link displayed in the context menu of a highlighted series.  If present, the source name of the highlighted series must match this regular expression in order for the link to be displayed

pointTagFilterRegexes.description: Controls whether a link displayed in the context menu of a highlighted series.  This is a map from string to regular expression. The highlighted series must contain point tags whose keys are present in the keys of this map and whose values match the regular expressions associated with those keys in order for the link to be displayed

description.description: Human-readable description for this external link

ExternalLink.description: Links that can be generated from Wavefront to other analytical platforms

facets.description: The requested facets, returned in a map whose key is the facet property and whose value is a list of facet values

message.description: Descriptive message of the status of this response

code.description: HTTP Response code corresponding to this response

target.description: For scope=CUSTOMER or scope=USER, the individual customer or user id

attributes.description: A string->string map of additional properties associated with this message

scope.description: The audience scope that this message should reach

startEpochMillis.description: When this message will begin to be displayed, in epoch millis

endEpochMillis.description: When this message will stop being displayed, in epoch millis

display.description: The form of display for this message

read.description: A derived field for whether the current user has read this message

source.description: Message source.  System messages will com from 'system@wavefront.com'

Message.description: A message for display to a particular user, all users within a customer, or all users on a cluster

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerMessage.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerSavedSearch.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

cursor.description: The id (exclusive) from which search results resume returning.  Users should supply an entity 'id' to this property.  Its main purpose is to resume where a previous search left off because of the 'limit' parameter.  If a user supplies the last id in a set of results to cursor, while keeping the query the same, the system will return the next page of results

query.description: A list of queries by which to limit the search results

sortSourcesAscending.description: Whether to sort source results ascending lexigraphically by id/sourceName.  Default: true

id.description: id of this source, must be exactly equivalent to 'sourceName'

hidden.description: A derived field denoting whether this source has been hidden (e.g. excluding it from query autocomplete among other things)

tags.description: A Map (String -> boolean) Representing the source tags associated with this source.  To create a tag, set it as a KEY in this map, with associated value equal to true

sourceName.description: The name of the source, usually set by ingested telemetry

Source.description: A source (sometimes called host) of time series data from telemetry ingestion

emailAddress.description: The (unique) identifier of the user to create.  Must be a valid email address

groups.description: List of permission groups to grant to this user.  Please note that 'host_tag_management' is the equivalent of the 'Source Tag Management' permission.  Possible values are browse, agent_management, alerts_management, dashboard_management, embedded_charts, events_management, external_links_management, host_tag_management, metrics_management, user_management

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerPagedSavedSearch.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

cursor.description: The id at which the current (limited) search can be continued to obtain more matching items

totalItems.description: An estimate (lower-bound) of the total number of items available for return.  May not be a tight estimate for facet queries

moreItems.description: Whether more items are available for return by increment offset or cursor

sort.description: How returned items have been sorted

bucketName.description: Name of the S3 bucket where CloudTrail logs are stored

prefix.description: The common prefix, if any, appended to all CloudTrail log files

CloudTrailConfiguration.description: Configurations specific to the CloudTrail AWS integration

hostNameTags.description: A list of AWS instance tags that, when found, will be used as the "source" name in a series.  Default: ["hostname", "host", "name"].  If no tag in this list is found, the series source is set to the instance id.

EC2Configuration.description: Configurations specific to the EC2 AWS integration

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerHistoryResponse.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

limit.description: The number of results to return.  Default: 100

offset.description: The number of results to skip before returning values.  Default: 0

query.description: A list of queries by which to limit the search results.  Entities that match ALL queries in the list are returned

sort.description: How to sort the items in the response

cursor.description: The id at which the current (limited) search can be continued to obtain more matching items

totalItems.description: An estimate (lower-bound) of the total number of items available for return.  May not be a tight estimate for facet queries

moreItems.description: Whether more items are available for return by increment offset or cursor

sort.description: How returned items have been sorted

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the point in milliseconds

field.description: The facet by which to sort

ascending.description: Whether to sort ascending.  If undefined, sorting is not guaranteed

startTime.description: Start time in milliseconds for the event

endTime.description: End time in milliseconds for the event. If missing, the event is ongoing

annotations.description: Annotations for the event. Searchable during queries

table.description: The customer that owns the event

ReportEvent.description: A reported event. Either user generated, ingested via an API or created by the firing of an alert

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerMapStringInteger.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

roleArn.description: The Role ARN that the customer has created in AWS IAM to allow access to Wavefront

externalId.description: The external id corresponding to the Role ARN

cursor.description: The id at which the current (limited) search can be continued to obtain more matching items

totalItems.description: An estimate (lower-bound) of the total number of items available for return.  May not be a tight estimate for facet queries

moreItems.description: Whether more items are available for return by increment offset or cursor

sort.description: How returned items have been sorted

cursor.description: The id at which the current (limited) search can be continued to obtain more matching items

totalItems.description: An estimate (lower-bound) of the total number of items available for return.  May not be a tight estimate for facet queries

moreItems.description: Whether more items are available for return by increment offset or cursor

sort.description: How returned items have been sorted

target.description: The email address or integration endpoint (such as PagerDuty or webhook) to notify when the alert status changes

status.description: Lists the current state of the alert. Can be one or more of: FIRING, SNOOZED, IN_MAINTENANCE, INVALID, NONE, CHECKING, TRASH

created.description: When this alert was created, in epoch millis

minutes.description: The number of consecutive minutes that a series matching the condition query must evaluate to "true" (non-zero value) before the alert fires

event.description: The event associated with the firing of the alert. Can be null if the alert has never fired. If the alert is not currently firing, the event holds the last known firing of the alert

condition.description: A Wavefront query that is evaluated at regular intervals (default 1m).  The alert fires and notifications are triggered when a data series matching this query evaluates to a non-zero value for a set number of consecutive minutes

conditionQBEnabled.description: Whether the condition query was created using the Query Builder.  Default false

conditionQBSerialization.description: The special serialization of the Query Builder that corresponds to the condition query.  Applicable only when conditionQBEnabled is true

displayExpression.description: A second query whose results are displayed in the alert user interface instead of the condition query. This field is often used to display a version of the condition query with Boolean operators removed so that numerical values are plotted

displayExpressionQBEnabled.description: Whether the display expression query was created using the Query Builder. Default false

displayExpressionQBSerialization.description: The special serialization of the Query Builder that corresponds to the display expression query.  Applicable only when displayExpressionQBEnabled is true

resolveAfterMinutes.description: The number of consecutive minutes that a firing series matching the condition query must evaluate to "false" (zero value) before the alert resolves.  When unset, this defaults to the same value as "minutes"

snoozed.description: The until which time this alert is snoozed (not checked), in epoch millis.  A negative value implies the alert is snoozed indefinitely

updated.description: When the alert was last updated, in epoch millis

queryFailing.description: Whether there was an exception when the alert condition last ran

lastFailedTime.description: The time of the last error encountered when running this alert's condition query, in epoch millis

lastErrorMessage.description: The last error encountered when running this alert's condition query

additionalInformation.description: User-supplied additional explanatory information for this alert.  Useful for linking runbooks, mitigations,, etc

metricsUsed.description: Number of metrics checked by the alert condition

hostsUsed.description: Number of hosts checked by the alert condition

inMaintenanceHostLabelPairs.description: Lists the sources that will not be checked for this alert, due to matching a maintenance window

activeMaintenanceWindows.description: The names of the active maintenance windows that are affecting this alert

updateUserId.description: The user that last updated this alert

prefiringHostLabelPairs.description: Lists the series that are starting to fail, defined as failing for greater than 50% of the checks in the window determined by the "minutes" parameter

notificants.description: A derived field listing the webhook ids used by this alert

lastProcessedMillis.description: The time when this alert was last checked, in epoch millis

processRateMinutes.description: The interval between checks for this alert, in minutes.  Defaults to 1 minute

pointsScannedAtLastQuery.description: A derived field recording the number of data points scanned when the system last computed this alert's condition

lastNotificationMillis.description: When this alert last caused a notification, in epoch millis

notificationResendFrequencyMinutes.description: How often to re-trigger a continually failing alert. If absent or <= 0, no retriggering occurs

name.description: The human-readable name of this integration

ec2.description: EC2 specific configurations. Only applicable when service=EC2

service.description: A value denoting which cloud service this integration integrates with

additionalTags.description: A list of point tag key-values to add to every point ingested using this integration

lastReceivedDataPointMs.description: Time that this integration last received a data point, in epoch millis

lastMetricCount.description: Number of metrics / events ingested by this integration the last time it ran

cloudWatch.description: CloudWatch specific configurations. Only applicable when service=CLOUDWATCH

cloudTrail.description: CloudTrail specific configurations. Only applicable when service=CLOUDTRAIL

lastError.description: Digest of the last error encountered by Wavefront servers when fetching data using this integration

lastErrorMs.description: Time, in epoch millis, of the last error encountered by Wavefront servers when fetching data using this integration

lastProcessorId.description: Opaque id of the last Wavefront integrations service to act on this integration

lastProcessingTimestamp.description: Time, in epoch millis, that this integration was last processed

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerPagedEvent.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

response.description: The response, if the request is successful

ResponseContainerDashboard.description: JSON container for the HTTP response along with status

customerTags.description: Customer-wide tags.  Can be on various wavefront entities such alerts or dashboards.

userTags.description: Deprecated.  Used to store user-specific tags, such as "favorite"
